docs.title: Welcome to My Blog
docs.text: This is my personal blog powered by MkDocs Material.

docs.title: Latest Posts
docs.text:
• First Post
  • Second Post

docs.title: About Me
docs.text: Hello! I'm a software developer and blogger. This blog is built with MkDocs Material.

docs.title: Actualización del sistema
docs.text:
sudo apt update
sudo apt dist-update

docs.title: Instalación de paquetes necesarios
docs.text: sudo apt-get install libnss-ldap libpam-ldap ldap-utils

docs.title: Ajustes en /etc/nsswitch.conf
docs.text: Establecer búsquedas de passwd, group, shadow y gshadow en ldap.

docs.title: Ajustes en /etc/pam.d/common-password
docs.text: Eliminar use_authok

docs.title: Ajustes en /etc/pam.d/common-session
docs.text:
Añadir la línea:

session optional    pam_mkhomedir.so skel=/etc/skel umask=077

docs.title: Habilitar el servicio libnss-ldap
docs.text: sudo systemctl start libnss-ldap.service

docs.title: Habilitar el inicio de sesión en modo gráfico
docs.text: sudo apt install nslcd

docs.title: Acceso a LAM a través del navegador
docs.text: http://<IP-Servidor>:389/lam

docs.title: Actualización del sistema
docs.text:
sudo apt update
sudo apt dist-update

docs.title: Resolución de host en /etc/hosts
docs.text:
#<IP> <hostname>.<dominio> <hostname>
192.168.104.10 ldap-server.iesguadalpena.es ldap-server

docs.title: Instalación del software LDAP
docs.text: sudo apt install slapd ldap-utils -y

docs.title: Habilitar servicio al encender el servidor
docs.text: sudo systemctl enable slapd.service

docs.title: Añadir un fichero al directorio
docs.text: sudo ldapadd -x -D cn=admin,dc=iesguadalpena,dc=es -W -f <nombre-fichero>.ldif

docs.title: Buscar elementos en el directorio
docs.text: sudo ldapsearch -xLLL -b "dc=iesguadalpena,dc=es" <condicion> <atributo-que-mostrar>

docs.title: Borrado de elementos en el directorio
docs.text: sudo ldapdelete -x -W -D "cn=admin,dc=iesguadalpena,dc=es" <dn-que-borrar>

docs.title: Modificación de elementos en el directorio
docs.text: sudo ldapmodify -x -D "cn=admin,dc=iesguadalpena,dc=es" -W -f <fichero>.ldif

docs.title: Fichero ejemplo: Modificación
docs.text:
dn: cn=wwomang,ou=usuarios,dc=iesguadalpena,dc=es
changetype: modify
replace: mail
mail: wwoman.garcia@g.educaand.es

docs.title: Editar archivo /etc/ldap/ldap.conf
docs.text:
BASE    dc=nombre-dominio,dc=extension
URI ldap://<IP>:389

docs.title: Creación de nuevo usuario
docs.text:
sudo adduser <nombre>
sudo usermod -aG sudo,adm <nombre>

docs.title: Cambio del hostname
docs.text: sudo hostnamectl set-hostname <hostname>

docs.title: Comprobación IPs máquina
docs.text: ip -br a

docs.title: Editar archivo de red /etc/netplan/99_config.yaml
docs.text:
network:
  version: 2
  renderer: networkd
  ethernets:
    ens18:
      dhcp4: true
    ens19:
      addresses:
        - 192.168.104.10/24

docs.title: Configurar la hora y zona horaria de Madrid
docs.text: sudo timedatectl set-timezone "Europe/Madrid"

docs.title: QEMU/KVM + libvirt
docs.text:
sudo apt install qemu-system libvirt-clients libvirt-daemon-system

sudo apt install virtinst

En Arch

sudo pacman -S qemu-full libvirt virt-install

sudo usermod -aG libvirt $USER

docs.title: vagrant
docs.text:
En Arch

yay -S vagrant

vagrant plugin install vagrant-libvirt
vagrant up --provider=libvirt

docs.title: Comprobación de las redes existentes
docs.text: virsh net-list --all

docs.title: Creación de la red interna
docs.text:
cat <<EOF > /tmp/red-interna.xml
<network>
  <name>red-interna</name>
  <forward mode='none'/>
  <ip address='10.20.30.1' netmask='255.255.255.0'/>
</network>
EOF

sudo virsh net-define /tmp/red-interna.xml
sudo virsh net-autostart red-interna
sudo virsh net-start red-interna

docs.title: Instalación
docs.text: ...

docs.title: Conectividad con Internet y red local
Comprobando interfaces
docs.text: ip link show

docs.title: Apagando algunas interfaces
docs.text: ip link set dev eth1 down

docs.title: Mostrando IPs
docs.text: ip -4 -br a

docs.title: Archivo de configuracion
docs.text:
/etc/network/interfaces

# This file describes the network interfaces available on your system
# and how to activate them. For more information, see interfaces(5).

source /etc/network/interfaces.d/*

# The loopback network interface
auto lo
iface lo inet loopback

# Alternative: DHCP configuration for eth0
# auto eth0
# iface eth0 inet dhcp

# The primary network interface (static IP example)
auto eth0
iface eth0 inet static
    address 192.168.1.100
    netmask 255.255.255.0
    network 192.168.1.0
    broadcast 192.168.1.255
    gateway 192.168.1.1
    # Optional: DNS servers
    dns-nameservers 8.8.8.8 8.8.4.4
    dns-search example.com

docs.title: Aplicación de los cambios
docs.text: sudo systemctl restart networking

docs.title: Archivo de configuracion
docs.text:
sudo vim /etc/netplan/50-cloud-init.yaml

network:
  version: 2
  ethernets:
    ens18:
      dhcp4: true

    ens19:
      dhcp4: false
      addresses:
        - 192.168.104.10/24
      nameservers:
        addresses:
          - 8.8.8.8
          - 8.8.4.4

docs.title: Aplicación de los cambios
docs.text: sudo netplan apply

docs.title: First Post
docs.text:
Published on 2025-10-06

Welcome to my first blog post! Here’s some content.

```python print("Hello MkDocs!")

docs.title: SuperFences
docs.text:
superfences.py is derived from Python Markdown's fenced_code extension.

Fenced Code Extension for Python Markdown
 =========================================
This extension adds Fenced Code Blocks to Python-Markdown.
See <https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/fenced_code_blocks/>
for documentation.
Original code Copyright 2007-2008 [Waylan Limberg](http://achinghead.com/).
All changes Copyright 2008-2014 The Python Markdown Project
License: [BSD](http://www.opensource.org/licenses/bsd-license.php)

docs.title: Highlight
docs.text:
highlight.py is derived from Python Markdown's CodeHilite extension.

CodeHilite Extension for Python-Markdown
 ========================================
Adds code/syntax highlighting to standard Python-Markdown code blocks.
See <https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/code_hilite/>
for documentation.
Original code Copyright 2006-2008 [Waylan Limberg](http://achinghead.com/).
All changes Copyright 2008-2014 The Python Markdown Project
